answers.answer: I've been having the same thing since yesterday...I'm currently 32 weeks. I'm not sure if it's normal or not. I didn't experience this in my other pregnancies
idk what is either :/ maybe someone does and they will be nice and help us.
It could be the baby pushing up against you. I would talk to yout doctor about it for sure because there are numerous things it could be and your doctor would help you figure out a lot easier.
Probably just baby! My daughter was constantly in my ribs before she finally dropped :)

I really dont mean to alarm you but i started getting that with my last pregnancy at 18 weeks...if the pain gets any worse and you start being sick call your midwife. This was first symptoms of pre eclamisa and HELLP syndrome for me. I honestly with all my heart hope it is the baby pushing you though !!! Just better to be safe than sorry xx

my aunt had preeclampsia with all her pregnancys and i told my doctor that so sjes been moitoring me close. my blood pressure and everything has been good. i go in monday so i will tell her. what is hellp syndrome?
It is heamolosis elevated liver enzymes and low platelet count ... so my blood wasnt clotting and my liver was shutting down xx

question: hi im a ftm im 20+6. lately it seems like the top of stomach feels super tight. its like hard for me to turn or even exhale when i breathe...is it normal? has anyone ever felt this before?
title: stomach tightening???
